product_details.description: Be unstoppable with the unprecedented speed of the world‚Äôs best desktop processors. AMD Ryzen 5000 Series processors deliver the ultimate in high performance, whether you‚Äôre playing the latest games, designing the next skyscraper or crunching scientific data. With AMD Ryzen, you‚Äôre always in the lead. The Simple and Powerful Overclocking Utility for AMD Ryzen processors.

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing CPU for Gaming!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
reviews.text: I have had this CPU for around exactly one year now. Normally I do all my tech reviews fairly early but I wanted to really use this chip, overclock it, game, and do lighting editing as well. To start off my full system is a Ryzen 5800X, Asus X570-Pro board, 32GB of 3600mhz G.Skill CL16 memory (4x8GB), EVGA G3 Supernova 850 watt 80+ Gold PSU, EVGA RTX 2070 Super GPU, Cooler Master NR600 Case, Noctua NH-D15 Chromax Black Edition CPU cooler. I have two Gen 4 NVMe drives and 4 normal sata SSD drives. My case is filled with all Cooler Master Masterpro ARGB high CFM airflow fans. I‚Äôm also using an internal wireless card as well as my particular x570 board doesn‚Äôt come with onboard WiFi. My reason for stating all this is the airflow and cooling in my case is exceptional. I have one of the highest airflow cases, with some of the best fans, one of the best CPU coolers, and I‚Äôm using Thermal Grizzly Kryonaunt paste which is hands down the best CPU test for overclocking and temps in general imo. Stating all this because YOUR temps may be different than mine as well as your results. To start of with the chip I‚Äôve not had ONE single issue with it so far after a year of use. ALL I have done to it after installing it in place of the Ryzen 3600 that it replaced was I enabled DOCP on my memory which is AMDs version of XMP and I enabled PBO on my chip with the max limit set at 200mhz. That it all I touched. This chip boosts to 5.1ghz when using 2-3 cores or less easily and even if under full load will still stay around 4.75ghz on all 8 cores at 100% load. In a more realistic load like gaming it runs around 4.75-4.95ghz. Under full load like Prime95 my temps top out around 74C. Idle is around low 30s and while gaming it bounces around 55-65C. It runs super fast and super cool. This is all on air cooling too. When going from the 3600 to the 5800X while every single other aspect of my system remained the same I gained anywhere from 10 fps to over 20 fps on some games. I play at 1440P as well. If you play at 1080P your results will be even better. This is the best chip I‚Äôve ever used and owned. My RTX 2070 Super is overclocked 1100mhz on the memory and 140mhz on the core. On benchmarks my scores beat all stock and even factory OC 2080 Supers. They also beat almost all RTX 3060 ti results as well. I‚Äôve never played a single game where this chip bottlenecks my card ever. Whereas with the 3600 it did from time to time. Especially in games using DLSS which renders the game at a much lower resolution then upscales it. That makes the game way more CPU demanding and in titles with DLSS my fps increase was huge. Absolutely amazing cpu for gaming and you don‚Äôt have to do anything other than enable PBO. Gone are the days of manual overclocking to get all the performance you paid for. The chips auto boost themselfs as high as they can go basically all by themselves now. If you have any Zen + or Zen 2 chip and wanna upgrade to Zen 3 aka Ryzen 5000 I say it‚Äôs well worth it for gaming. The IPC increase on Ryzen 5000 over 3000 series is huge. Over 30% faster. I‚Äôve included pictures of my setup, CPUz info, benchmark results, MSI Afterburner temperature info after playing Witcher 3 at 1440P on Ultra settings for hours, and many other others. The chip boosts high, runs cool, requires basically no knowledge to get max performance from it outside of TWO toggles in the bios, and at its current price is an amazing value imo. Fast enough to pair any GPU on the market with it if you can find one. I‚Äôve been wanting a 3080 forever now but just no luck. I paid the MSRP of 450 for this chip and don‚Äôt regret it at all. No crashes, no issues ever, never breaks 70C while daily use/gaming no matter how long, boosts over 5ghz, and has enough cores/threads if you wanna stream and multitask while gaming you‚Äôre good to go. I think AMD did an amazing job with Zen 3 and if you‚Äôre interested in the 5800X for gaming/streaming you won‚Äôt go wrong. Hope this review helped and if it does please leave a like. Enjoy the pics and thanks for reading.Read more

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 starsplease read the first paragraph at least!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.text: so, i was one of the (statistically few) who hit the silicon lottery and struck dirt. basically, my 5800x was defective. this is just a PSA, if you encounter BSODs/crashes to reboot/fatal hardware errors after installing your new CPU, it is likely defective. i was getting WHEA_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR at random times, event IDs WHEA-18 and 46. no combination of the CPU with a new motherboard, different ram, 1 stick of ram, XMP profiles off, PBO disabled, bios updates, windows reinstalls, chipset driver updates, or other device driver updates resolved the issue for me. it would occur under any load at any temperature. it's also worth mentioning that it worked fine for about 5 days before issues started to happen. if your PC is producing errors you simply cannot resolve and it started with the new CPU, please return it ASAP!! i have ordered a new one already and shipped the defective unit back. i used my old ryzen 2600 to isolate the 5800x as the issue, and my system runs completely stable as long as i keep it on. i'm sad it was defective, but ultimately, i'm not going to let it damage my opinion of the CPU, as defective products are guaranteed to slip through here and there, and amazon is extremely good about their return policy in my experience.anyway, with that out of the way, let's talk about the CPU itself. when mine was functioning normally, it was awesome. coming from an old ryzen 5 2600, the performance gain of the 5800x is a night and day difference. it's 3 years old now, but its price and still-relevant performance make it an immensely good value. it squeezed new fps gains out of my gtx 1080, and was far more than enough for my new rtx 4070. the gains in performance are even more obvious now that i'm back on the 2600 while i wait for my replacement to arrive. it was as easy to install as any other AM3/AM4 CPU. i will give a heads up however that it does run hot and is known to do so. however, AMD has explicitly stated that even 90¬∞C is safe at full load. a high quality air cooler will be enough if you don't plan on doing serious overclocking, like me. a thermalright peerless assassin or scythe fuma should be more than enough for stock clocks with PBO left on auto. i paired this with 32gb of gskill ripjaws V with 3600mhz XMP profile, and the two paired wonderfully. the motherboard i ended up with is an MSI MAG B550 tomahawk max wifi, but the CPU will work just fine on most B450/X470 motherboards as long as your bios is up to date!!!! please do not let my disclaimer dissuade you from buying this amazing CPU, it can happen to anyone who buys any CPU, from Intel too! i can't wait for my replacement to arrive and complete my system, i wholeheartedly recommend this CPU for great performance per dollar.Read more

reviews.title: Good time to upgrade
reviews.text: Scored it for a great price which made upgrading from my 3600 a great value. 8 cores, super high boost speeds, it performs great. AMDs support of the AM4 platform for so long has really allowed people to stretch out the lifespan of their older systems providing a nice upgrade path even still.I  read that it can run hot but so far the hyper 212 halo I got for it is doing a great job keeping it cool. I don't plan on any overclocking.  Would have liked a 5800x3D but the price is too much for me.  For what I play it would have been overkill anyway.AMD has come a long way and their CPU's and GPUs are of great value for performance.Read more

reviews.title: Buen producto pero hay que tomar consideraciones
reviews.text: El producto es muy bueno. Es un procesador que por sus caracter√≠sticas permite sacar el m√°ximo provecho a juegos (raz√≥n por la que yo lo compr√©). Actualmente tengo mi computadora junto con una rtx 3060 y me parece que el rendimiento es √≥ptimo y de mucha calidad.Mi computadora tiene una refrigeraci√≥n bastante buena creo yo, por lo que no me preocupa medir las temperaturas. Adem√°s, tampoco soy el tipo de usuario que se dedica a ver estad√≠sticas para ver cu√°nto rendimiento est√°n dando los programas que ejecuto. Lo m√°s que hago es usar la aplicaci√≥n de Nvidia y ver los porcentajes que me brinda. Mi experiencia de juego es buena y eso es suficiente para m√≠. Tengo claro que para aprovechar al m√°ximo este procesador es importante la refrigeraci√≥n que se le pueda dar, por lo que las recomendaciones que yo dar√≠a para comprar este procesador son dos:-- En verdad considera la refrigeraci√≥n y el espacio de tu gabinete, ser√°n de mucha ayuda para que permita al procesador trabajar con libertad.-- Los componentes que acompa√±an al procesador deben ser acorde a la calidad de este. No me refiero al precio o marca, m√°s bien al rendimiento que deben dar para no causar un cuello de botella excesivo.Read more

reviews.title: Excelente processador
reviews.text: Produto muito bom mesmo, s√≥ tenho elogios pois √© extremamente potente e quando soma com uma 4060 e 32GB de RAM fica muito top, e outro ponto que me deixou muito feliz foi o pre√ßo que foi muito abaixo do pre√ßo atual. O ponto negativo foi apenas a embalagem pois n√£o veio t√£o bem protegido como outros produtos que comprei, mas chegou dentro do prazo.OBS: Por ser um produto de alto desempenho recomendo comprar se voc√™ j√° tiver equipamento compat√≠vel para n√£o ter limita√ß√µes entre placa de video e processador.Read more

Requiere una tarjeta gr√°fica.‚Ä¢ Calor bajo carga extrema, requiere refrigeraci√≥n de calidad.‚Ä¢ No incluye disipador.‚Ä¢ Modelo de 2020, no es la √∫ltima generaci√≥n (Ryzen 7 9700X lanzado en Q3/2024).üéõÔ∏è MONTAJE DE MI PC- Placa base: MSI Placa base MPG B550 Gaming Plus - https://amzn.to/4gO0mo7- Gr√°fica: Gigabyte NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 GAMING - https://amzn.to/49PsnJM- Memoria RAM: CORSAIR VENGEANCE RGB PRO DDR4 - https://amzn.to/49VwWCj- Fuente de alimentaci√≥n: Aerocool MIRAGEGOLD 750W - https://amzn.to/49NYxp9- Refrigeraci√≥n: UNYKAch Refrigeraci√≥n L√≠quida CPU - https://amzn.to/4fCy5js- Caja gaming: Mars Gaming MC-mag ATX - https://amzn.to/3DqiaHw- Fundas ARGB: FUNDAS ARGB MARS GAMING PARA TUBOS DE REFRIGERACI√ìN - -https://amzn.to/3ZPG8Un- Rat√≥n gaming: SteelSeries Aerox 3 Wireless - https://amzn.to/3VVg2hA- Teclado gaming: SteelSeries Apex Pro TKL Wireless - https://amzn.to/41OkzWL8Ô∏è‚É£ VALORACI√ìNüíª Mont√© este PC pensando en el Fortnite del ni√±o, y la verdad es que va de maravilla. La CPU y la gr√°fica trabajan a un  60% de uso, con un rendimiento fluido y sin cuellos de botella. Adem√°s, las temperaturas se mantienen bajo control, con el procesador rondando los 65 ¬∫C en plena acci√≥n.‚öôÔ∏è Este modelo de procesador sigue siendo una apuesta segura para gaming y multitarea. Su configuraci√≥n de 8 n√∫cleos y 16 hilos ofrece una experiencia muy equilibrada, incluso para t√≠tulos exigentes. Lo m√°s destacable es su capacidad para mantener una alta frecuencia sin penalizar la eficiencia energ√©tica, aunque bajo carga m√°xima requiere un sistema de refrigeraci√≥n competente.Lo que mucha gente no sabe, es que este modelo de Ryzen no viene con gr√°ficos integrados en el procesador, por lo que si lo montas sin tarjeta gr√°fica, no tendr√°s salida de v√≠deo por tu placa base. Para ello vas a necesitar comprar una tarjeta gr√°fica dedicada. Si quieres un procesador con gr√°ficos integrados, son los que terminan en G, como √©ste: https://amzn.to/4gqHoU3üõ†Ô∏è A pesar de no ser de √∫ltima generaci√≥n, su relaci√≥n calidad-precio lo hace destacar frente a opciones m√°s recientes. El montaje del PC fue sencillo con los componentes que eleg√≠, y hasta ahora, todo ha funcionado como esperaba. Lo m√°s importante: no hay ca√≠das de rendimiento ni problemas de compatibilidad.Personalmente, resulta m√°s seguro montar procesadores AMD que Intel. Las diferencias entre ellos, es que lo intel, los procesadores son planos y el socket tiene los pines, pero es muy f√°cil que se doblen los pines. En el AMD, los pines est√°n en el procesador y salvo que te caiga, no vas a tener problemas por montar y desmontar sin da√±ar las patillas. Me dan mayor seguridad.‚úÖ CONCLUSI√ìNAunque lanzado en 2020, sigue siendo una opci√≥n actual y eficiente, perfectamente v√°lido para gaming sin comprometer temperaturas ni rendimiento.üëç RECOMENDABLE.‚ú≥Ô∏è Espero que mi comentario ‚úçÔ∏è te haya podido servir de ayuda üòÉRead more

top_positive_reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAmazing CPU for Gaming!
top_positive_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
top_positive_reviews.text: I have had this CPU for around exactly one year now. Normally I do all my tech reviews fairly early but I wanted to really use this chip, overclock it, game, and do lighting editing as well. To start off my full system is a Ryzen 5800X, Asus X570-Pro board, 32GB of 3600mhz G.Skill CL16 memory (4x8GB), EVGA G3 Supernova 850 watt 80+ Gold PSU, EVGA RTX 2070 Super GPU, Cooler Master NR600 Case, Noctua NH-D15 Chromax Black Edition CPU cooler. I have two Gen 4 NVMe drives and 4 normal sata SSD drives. My case is filled with all Cooler Master Masterpro ARGB high CFM airflow fans. I‚Äôm also using an internal wireless card as well as my particular x570 board doesn‚Äôt come with onboard WiFi. My reason for stating all this is the airflow and cooling in my case is exceptional. I have one of the highest airflow cases, with some of the best fans, one of the best CPU coolers, and I‚Äôm using Thermal Grizzly Kryonaunt paste which is hands down the best CPU test for overclocking and temps in general imo. Stating all this because YOUR temps may be different than mine as well as your results. To start of with the chip I‚Äôve not had ONE single issue with it so far after a year of use. ALL I have done to it after installing it in place of the Ryzen 3600 that it replaced was I enabled DOCP on my memory which is AMDs version of XMP and I enabled PBO on my chip with the max limit set at 200mhz. That it all I touched. This chip boosts to 5.1ghz when using 2-3 cores or less easily and even if under full load will still stay around 4.75ghz on all 8 cores at 100% load. In a more realistic load like gaming it runs around 4.75-4.95ghz. Under full load like Prime95 my temps top out around 74C. Idle is around low 30s and while gaming it bounces around 55-65C. It runs super fast and super cool. This is all on air cooling too. When going from the 3600 to the 5800X while every single other aspect of my system remained the same I gained anywhere from 10 fps to over 20 fps on some games. I play at 1440P as well. If you play at 1080P your results will be even better. This is the best chip I‚Äôve ever used and owned. My RTX 2070 Super is overclocked 1100mhz on the memory and 140mhz on the core. On benchmarks my scores beat all stock and even factory OC 2080 Supers. They also beat almost all RTX 3060 ti results as well. I‚Äôve never played a single game where this chip bottlenecks my card ever. Whereas with the 3600 it did from time to time. Especially in games using DLSS which renders the game at a much lower resolution then upscales it. That makes the game way more CPU demanding and in titles with DLSS my fps increase was huge. Absolutely amazing cpu for gaming and you don‚Äôt have to do anything other than enable PBO. Gone are the days of manual overclocking to get all the performance you paid for. The chips auto boost themselfs as high as they can go basically all by themselves now. If you have any Zen + or Zen 2 chip and wanna upgrade to Zen 3 aka Ryzen 5000 I say it‚Äôs well worth it for gaming. The IPC increase on Ryzen 5000 over 3000 series is huge. Over 30% faster. I‚Äôve included pictures of my setup, CPUz info, benchmark results, MSI Afterburner temperature info after playing Witcher 3 at 1440P on Ultra settings for hours, and many other others. The chip boosts high, runs cool, requires basically no knowledge to get max performance from it outside of TWO toggles in the bios, and at its current price is an amazing value imo. Fast enough to pair any GPU on the market with it if you can find one. I‚Äôve been wanting a 3080 forever now but just no luck. I paid the MSRP of 450 for this chip and don‚Äôt regret it at all. No crashes, no issues ever, never breaks 70C while daily use/gaming no matter how long, boosts over 5ghz, and has enough cores/threads if you wanna stream and multitask while gaming you‚Äôre good to go. I think AMD did an amazing job with Zen 3 and if you‚Äôre interested in the 5800X for gaming/streaming you won‚Äôt go wrong. Hope this review helped and if it does please leave a like. Enjoy the pics and thanks for reading.Read more

Las diferencias entre ellos, es que lo intel, los procesadores son planos y el socket tiene los pines, pero es muy f√°cil que se doblen los pines. Me dan mayor seguridad.‚úÖ CONCLUSI√ìNAunque lanzado en 2020, sigue siendo una opci√≥n actual y eficiente, perfectamente v√°lido para gaming sin comprometer temperaturas ni rendimiento.üëç RECOMENDABLE.‚ú≥Ô∏è Espero que mi comentario ‚úçÔ∏è te haya podido servir de ayuda üòÉRead more

top_positive_reviews.text: El producto es muy bueno. Es un procesador que por sus caracter√≠sticas permite sacar el m√°ximo provecho a juegos (raz√≥n por la que yo lo compr√©). Actualmente tengo mi computadora junto con una rtx 3060 y me parece que el rendimiento es √≥ptimo y de mucha calidad.Mi computadora tiene una refrigeraci√≥n bastante buena creo yo, por lo que no me preocupa medir las temperaturas.
